title: Boy, 12, suspended from school for 10 days after he hugged teacher
text:
Julie Orozco said her 12-year-old foster son was suspended from Forest Grove Middle School for hugging a teacher. (Picture: NBC)

A 12-year-old boy was suspended from school for physical assault – all because he hugged his gym teacher.

The incident that originally earned the student a ten-day suspension and a record for assaulting a teacher occurred at Forest Grove Middle School in Worcester, Massachusetts last month.

The boy’s foster mother, Julie Orozco, said her foster son left a ‘difficult home situation’ in March and has since worked hard to get good grades and have perfect attendance. Now she fears the situation will damage his permanent record.

Orozco told NBC: ‘I was told he had put his hands on a teacher. I was shocked and asked for details on what happened, and then I was told that he hugged his gym teacher.’

The boy, who is not named because of his age, said: ‘At the end of the day, I just hugged her, nothing really happened.’

Orozco told the Telegram that her foster son’s race might have been a factor, as he is black and his teacher is white. Oroszo also said a school administrator told her the incident could have been perceived as sexual assault.

He admitted that he was fooling around with classmates in his gym class. He said his teacher then told him to sit out of the class dodgeball game.

‘And then I went over just like, and gave her a hug and said, “Please, I don’t want to sit out” because I like the game,’ the boy said.

After five minutes, the teacher allowed him to participate in the class, but he was then called to the principal’s office during the next period.

Orozco said: ‘I don’t expect the teacher to have to be OK with being touched or being hugged, but I do expect as an educator that she educate what the boundaries are in her classroom.’

‘If you can admit to me that you didn’t have a mechanism or a process, or any way of informing students what your expectations were, but then in the same breath you say to me, “He’s 12, he should know hugs are not OK,” it’s confounding.’

After calling, emailing, and meeting with the school, Orozco was able to get the boy’s suspension reduced to four days and the ‘physical assault’ mark on his record reduced to ‘disruption of school.’

The school has not commented on the matter.
description: A 12-year-old boy was suspended from Forest Grove Middle School in Worcester, Massachusetts for hugging a teacher.
